intro: Guettarda roigiana, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of yellow, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and arranged oppositely along the stems. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
